title: Harry Dunn's family to sue wife of US diplomat who fled to States after his death
text:

The family of Harry Dunn are to sue the wife of a US diplomat who fled to the States after his death.

They are also starting legal action against Donald Trump's administration for "lawless misconduct".

Harry, 19, died after being knocked off his motorbike near RAF Croughton, a US spy base, on August 27.

Anne Sacoolas is believe to have hit the teenager after driving on the wrong side of the road and returned to America soon after the incident.

Harry's family have been fighting a high-profile campaign to get Mrs Sacoolas to return to the UK to answer questions.

The family have already started a case against the Foreign Office over the decision to grant her immunity.

Earlier this month his parents visited Donald Trump at the White House where the president had arranged for Mrs Sacoolas to meet them but they declined.

Spokesperson for Harry Dunn's family Radd Seiger told Sky News he has instructed lawyers in the US and they will sue Mrs Sacoolas for civil damages and the Trump administration for misconduct and cover-up.

(Image: PA)

"We are bringing claims against both Mrs Sacoolas in the USA for civil damages as well as the Trump administration for their lawless misconduct and attempt to cover that up," said a statement.

"No one is above the law and the family are determined to ensure that this never happens to another family again.

"It will be Harry's memorial. His legacy."

(Image: REUTERS)

Mr Seiger said the US government had tried to "twist and contort the laws on diplomatic immunity" and called the White House attempt to get the family and Mrs Sacoolas in the same room a "disgusting stunt".

"The Trump administration is not only hell bent on breaking international laws, rules and conventions on diplomatic immunity, but they have no care or concern for the welfare of Harry's family or any real intent on finding a solution," said their spokesman.

(Image: PA)

He added: "President Trump told mum Charlotte at the meeting that we would look to approach the problem from a different angle, but the family have heard no further and have no faith in his words."

Last week British police confirmed they would interview Mrs Sacoolas under caution in the US.
description: President Donald Trump has failed to deliver on the pledge he made to Harry's parents at the White House, says a family spokesman
